availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Lucas (Clay Co, Ky, grocer and soldier)

body.p: Clay County, Kentucky, grocer. Clay County, Kentucky, native. Married to Maria Williams Lucas in Clay County, Kentucky on October 10, 1854. Father of Delora Lucas, Harvey Lucas, Greene Lucas, and Elizabeth Lucas. Served in the 16th Kentucky Regiment (U.S.A.) from April 22, 1847 to August 5, 1848. Resident of Clay County in 1850. Grocer in Clay County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Kentucky District, p. 153A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Manchester, p. 1.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clay County, Precinct 1, p. 172A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Clay County Marriages, Film #, p.3.
U.S. Army Register of Enlistments, 1798-1914, “Mexican War Enlistments,” NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M233, p. 155-156.
